newsitem.title: USA: Ford U.S. total market share slips.
newsitem.headline: Ford U.S. total market share slips.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Wednesday its U.S. car and truck market share in the first quarter fell to 25.1 percent from 25.8 percent in the year-ago first quarter.
The automaker's first quarter U.S. market share is also down from 26.2 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996.

In Europe, Ford said, its first-quarter market share fell to 11.4 percent from 12.1 percent a year ago. However, the European first quarter 1997 market share was up from 11.0 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996.
Ford said its U.S. total marketing costs in the first quarter rose to 9.4 percent of revenue from 9.3 percent a year ago and 6.8 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996.
Ford does not provide retail incentives per vehicle information, as the other members of the U.S. Big Three automakers do.
Ford's first quarter worldwide profit per vehicle was $874, more than double the year-ago period's $399.
Ford said in the first quarter, its fleet sales grew to 27 percent of its U.S. sales mix from 26 percent in the year-ago first quarter and 23 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996.
